description: Microsoft initially released Windows Live Movie Maker in 2000 as part of the Windows Essentials software suite, renamed it "Windows Movie Maker" in 2012, and then replaced it with the Photos app that comes with Windows 10. The program allows users to create and edit movies and slideshows and apply effects (saved as WLMX files) that come with the editor.

When editing a video with Windows Live Movie Maker, you can choose from various video and audio effects to apply to your video. WLMX files store these effects and are included with the Windows Live Movie Maker installation.
